reg:regulation.reg:title: Naturopathic Physicians Regulation
reg:regulation.reg:amsincluded: [includes amendments up to B.C. Reg. 156/2009, April 9, 2009]

bcl:definition.bcl:text: Act means the Health Professions Act;

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: in respect of a drug, to mix with one or more other ingredients, and
in respect of a therapeutic diet, to mix two or more ingredients;

bcl:definition.bcl:text: drug means, except in the definition of "substance", a drug

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: specified in Schedule I of the Drug Schedules Regulation, B.C. Reg. 9/98, other than a drug set out in the Schedule of this regulation, or
specified in Schedule II of the Drug Schedules Regulation;

bcl:definition.bcl:text: enteral instillation means instillation directly into the gastrointestinal tract;
minor surgery means a surgical procedure that

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: is performed, for a diagnostic or therapeutic purpose, on a superficial anatomical structure, and
does not involve

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: sedation, general anaesthesia or respiratory assistance, or
a material risk to life;

bcl:definition.bcl:text: naturopathic medicine means the health profession in which a person provides the services of prevention, assessment and treatment of an individual's diseases, disorders and conditions using education and naturopathic techniques, therapies or therapeutics to stimulate or support healing processes and promote, maintain or restore the overall health of the individual;
parenteral instillation means instillation directly into the blood stream;
prescribe means to issue a prescription, as defined in the Pharmacy Operations and Drug Scheduling Act;
substance includes air and water, but excludes a drug specified in Schedule I, IA, II or IV of the Drug Schedules Regulation.

bcl:section.bcl:text: The name "College of Naturopathic Physicians of British Columbia" is the name of the college established under section 15 (1) of the Act for naturopathic medicine.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: The following titles are reserved for exclusive use by registrants:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: naturopath;
naturopathic physician;
naturopathic doctor;
physician;
doctor.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: This section does not prevent a person from using

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the title "physician" or "doctor" in a manner authorized by another enactment that regulates a health profession, or
an academic or educational designation that the person is entitled to use.

bcl:section.bcl:text: A registrant may practise naturopathic medicine.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: A registrant in the course of practising naturopathic medicine may do any of the following:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: use naturopathic techniques to make a diagnosis identifying, as the cause of signs or symptoms of an individual, a disease, disorder or condition;
perform a procedure on tissue

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: below the dermis, or
below the surface of a mucous membrane;

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: administer a substance

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: by injection,
by inhalation,
by irrigation,
by enteral instillation or parenteral instillation, or
using a hyperbaric chamber;

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: put an instrument or a device or finger

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: into the external ear canal, up to the eardrum,
beyond the point in the nasal passages where they normally narrow,
beyond the opening of the urethra,
beyond the labia majora,
beyond the anal verge, or
into an artificial opening into the body;

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: put into the external ear canal, up to the eardrum, a substance that is under pressure;
apply

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: ultrasound for diagnostic or imaging purposes, including any application of ultrasound to a fetus,
electricity for the purposes of

bcl:clause.bcl:text: destroying tissue in the course of minor surgery, or
defibrillation in the course of emergency cardiac care, or

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: X-rays for diagnostic or imaging purposes, excluding X-rays for the purpose of computerized axial tomography;

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: in respect of a drug,

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: prescribe the drug,
compound the drug,
dispense the drug, or
administer the drug by any method;

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: if nutrition is administered by enteral instillation or parenteral instillation,

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: select ingredients for a therapeutic diet,
compound a therapeutic diet, or
dispense a therapeutic diet;

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: conduct challenge testing for allergies

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: that involves injection, scratch tests or inhalation, if the individual being tested has not had a previous anaphylactic reaction, or
by any method, if the individual being tested has had a previous anaphylactic reaction;

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: conduct desensitizing treatment for allergies

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: that involves injection, scratch tests or inhalation, if the individual being tested has not had a previous anaphylactic reaction, or
by any method, if the individual being tested has had a previous anaphylactic reaction.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: Only a registrant may practise naturopathic medicine.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Limits or conditions on services and restricted activities

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: A registrant may perform only surgery that is minor surgery.
A registrant may prescribe, compound, dispense or administer a drug only if

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: standards, limits and conditions have been established, under section 19 (1) (k) or (l) of the Act, respecting the prescribing, compounding, dispensing and administering of drugs by registrants,
the standards, limits and conditions described in paragraph (a) are established on the recommendation of a committee that

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: is established under section 19 (1) (t) of the Act, and
has the duty and power to develop, review and recommend those standards, limits and conditions, and

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the registrant has successfully completed a certification program established, required or approved under the bylaws to ensure that registrants are qualified and competent to prescribe, compound, dispense or administer a drug.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: A registrant may perform an activity described in section 5 (1) (d) (v), (k) or (l) only if

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: standards, limits and conditions have been established, under section 19 (1) (k) or (l) of the Act, respecting the activity, and
the standards, limits and conditions described in paragraph (a) are established on the recommendation of a committee that

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: is established under section 19 (1) (t) of the Act, and
has the duty and power to develop, review and recommend those standards, limits and conditions.

bcl:section.bcl:text: The college is designated for the purposes of section 16 (2) (f) of the Act.
Part 4 of the Act applies to naturopathic medicine.

oasis:entry.oasis:line: Codeine when prescribed as a single entity or
when included in a preparation containing
60 mg or more per dosage unit
Amprenavir and its salts and derivatives
Anakinra and its salts and derivatives
Didanosine and its salts and derivatives
Dinoprostone and its salts and derivatives
Capecitabine and its salts and derivatives
Chlorambucil and its salts and derivatives
Lincomycin and its salts and derivatives
Fludarabine and its salts and derivatives
Fluorouracil and its derivatives for parenteral
Loracarbef and its salts and derivatives
Formestane and its salts and derivatives
Ganirelix and its salts and derivatives
Meropenem and its salts and derivatives
Mycophenolic acid and its salts and derivatives
Netilmicin and its salts and derivatives
Kanamycin and its salts and derivatives
Tenofovir and its salts and derivatives
Raltitrexed and its salts and derivatives
Saquinavir and its salts and derivatives
Viomycin and its salts and derivatives
Zoledronic acid and its salts and derivatives

reg:content.reg:provisionsnote: [Provisions of the Health Professions Act, R.S.B.C. 1996, c. 183, relevant to the enactment of this regulation: section 12 (2)]
